intro: Heterotheca oligantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Heterotheca oligantha is adapted to arid environments and is often used in native plant landscaping due to its drought tolerance.
